title: India beat SL by 62 runs in first T20I
content: India beat Sri Lanka by 62 runs in the first T20I in Lucknow.After being sent into bat first, India amassed 199 for two.Top-scorer for India was Ishan Kishan, who made 89 off just 56 deliveries.His innings included three sixes and 10 fours.Shreyas Iyer’s 28-ball 57 with two sixes and five fours, and 44 runs in 32 deliveries by skipper Rohit Sharma ensured the hosts made a big total.In bowling for Sri Lanka, Lahiru Kumara and Dasun Shanaka took one wicket each.Replying, Sri Lanka managed only 137 for six, with Charith Asalanka making an unbeaten 53 off 47 deliveries with five fours.Dushmantha Chameera was not out on a 14–ball 24.
